column4: I tried installing Ubuntu 10.10 but I get a [drm] nouveau error saying something like "bit 16 expected = 0 but was 0x011000000" or something or other
I read it could be related to the fact that I have an nvidia quadro card
I too have a quadro. I had to switch to the nv or nvidia driver
well this is during the install... so not sure how to do that
how is the nv/nvidia driver compared to the nouveau driver?
hmm, I'll check again.. I only saw some graphical menu
I think the alternate iso has a text only version
how is the nv/nvidia driver, just as good (hopefully) as the nouveau?
at least for my card, the nv driver was better.
can you do lsmod -v | grep n
the machine with the quadro is at home, I'm at work
